Planet Munnar is located in a serene, remote part of the picturesque Suryanelli hills. Very good for a break from the hustle and bustle of modern life. The property is charming, well laid-out and the rooms are spacious, with good decor. My daughter used the swimming pool and liked it. Quality of food (breakfast and dinner) was good. The staff was helpful and polite. They helped arrange a cab driver to take us around for sightseeing. Campfire in the evening was a bonus. The property is still expa

Literally everything, from the smiles on the faces of the staff to how organised they were WiFi could have been better but let's pretend it's the 80's and have a conscious time in nature We literally saw hummingbirds there so poor WiFi no problem for me.

The team, including Jinib and George were excellent and thought of everything. Attention to detail was great. The food was also fantastic. It was just a few minutes stroll to the beach down the track from the villa. The beach was quiet. We don‚Äôt swim but did paddle. Overall a really re

reviews.review_title: Jibin was an amazing host. Food was wonderful. Room and bed were comfortable and more than adequate.
reviews.review_text: The pool Loved everything

Very peaceful location and characterful property with everything we needed. Clean, spacious, good food and amazing staff. Mosquito repellents, cream and coils provided. Bathrobes, slippers, beach towels and beautiful large fluffy white bathroom towels, bathroom products provided Nice pool area with two comfortable sunbeds and a hammock. No restaurant on site but freshly cooked food ordered daily brought to the property and served in the garden. Lovely setting and spot on time every single meal c

Rupert made sure we were getting on fine. The beach is a big plus, as it is slightly away from the busy bit, and is kept very clean. Clean pool, definitely need to cool down. Food was delicious. Comfy bed. Nothing to do with the team, more issues faced as parents with a baby, but being a vintage property reassembled it does retain

This was a blissful stay at the end of 2 weeks travelling around Kerala. We stayed here for 3 nights for my husbands 40th birthday and had a wonderful relaxing time. Jibin and the rest of the team were so friendly and helpful. The food was delicious - some of the best we had including kid friendly options. The villas are very private and we barely saw anyone else at all. Incredibly clean and comfortable The beach is pretty and largely deserted apart from the odd fisherman/ stray dog - we walked

reviews.review_title: private, traditional villa with everything you need and lovely staff
reviews.review_text: lovely villa and so close to the beautiful deserted beach. having a private pool was great. friendly staff and lovely food, thank you to Jibin who looked after us, and chef and the ladies.Though what was also lovely was the privacy of having our own place.

the staff were so friendly and helpful. thank you to George and his team for welcoming us and being so helpful. we were a short walk from the sea which was great. the pool in the villa was lovely. the whole villa was kept very clean. the food was really great and reasonable priced.

All the staff (Jibin, George, Benjamin, chef, the cleaning ladies) were efficient and attentive, going out of their way to make us comfortable. The food was lovely - cooked to order so they catered to our taste(s). The beach was a short walk away and was clean and safe. The pool was cleaned by Benjamin every day and was cool & refreshing. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. The property is in need of some work to bring it up to standard eg leaking sink in bathroom, air-con leaking onto the bed,

If you are looking for a private and personalized luxury stay, then this is it. We loved the villa, the food, the staff. The place has only 3 villas and is very boutique. Owned by a foreigner couple, Marari villa is perfectly designed for privacy and peace of mind. Just 300mts from the beach this villa is a hidden gem. The shower pressure could be better for hot water.
